pageTitle: Accessibility statement for Claim money back from Access to Work
h1: Accessibility statement for Access to Work - claim money back

p1.link: This service is part of the wider GOV.UK website. There’s a separate accessibility statement for the main GOV.UK website.

p2.link: This page only contains information about the claim money back service from Access to Work, available at https://www.get-disability-work-support.service.gov.uk/claim.

p3: This service is run by the Department of Work and Pensions (DWP).

bulletPoints.paragraph: We want as many people as possible to be able to use this service. For example, that means you should be able to:
bulletPoints.pointOne: change colours, contrast levels and fonts
bulletPoints.pointTwo: zoom in up to 400% without the text spilling off the screen
bulletPoints.pointThree: get from the start of the service to the end using just a keyboard
bulletPoints.pointFour: get from the start of the service to the end using speech recognition software
bulletPoints.pointFive: listen to the service using screen readers such as Dragon, JAWS and Apple VoiceOver

p4: We've also made the text in the service as simple as possible to understand.

p5.link: AbilityNet has advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability.

p6: Some people may find parts of this service difficult to use:

bulletPoints2.pointOne: The receipt or invoice upload function can be time consuming for users who upload multiple documents
bulletPoints2.pointTwo: Claim PDFs used by DWP agents are not fully accessible to screen readers. Additional support is provided to staff, where needed.

p7: If you need information on this website in a different format like accessible PDF, large print, easy read, audio recording or braille, you can contact us for free:

bulletPoints3.pointThree: Relay UK (if you cannot hear or speak on the phone) 18001 then 0800 121 7479

pointFour.link2: find out how to use the Video Relay Service

bulletPoints4.pointOne: the web address (URL) of the content you need

p9: We’ll consider your request and get back to you as soon as possible.
h5: Reporting accessibility problems with this service

p10.link: We're always looking to improve the accessibility of this service. If you find any problems that are not listed on this page or think we're not meeting accessibility requirements, you can report an accessibility problem (opens in a new tab).

p11.textOne: The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) is responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the 'accessibility regulations').
p11.link: If you're not happy with how we respond to your complaint, contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS).

h7: Technical information about this service's accessibility
p12: The Department for Work and Pensions is committed to making this service accessible, in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.

p13.link: This service is fully compliant with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines version 2.2 AA standard.

p14: The service was last tested on 27 May 2025 and was checked for compliance with WCAG 2.2 AA. The tests were carried out by the Department for Work and Pensions. We tested a sample of pages that represent the implementation of each type of design pattern and interaction used in the service.
p15: This page was prepared on 27 May 2025.
